AcceptPortfolioShare.name: AcceptPortfolioShare
AcceptPortfolioShare.documentation: Accepts an offer to share the specified portfolio.

AssociatePrincipalWithPortfolio.name: AssociatePrincipalWithPortfolio
AssociatePrincipalWithPortfolio.documentation: Associates the specified principal ARN with the specified portfolio.

AssociateProductWithPortfolio.name: AssociateProductWithPortfolio
AssociateProductWithPortfolio.documentation: Associates the specified product with the specified portfolio.

AssociateTagOptionWithResource.name: AssociateTagOptionWithResource
AssociateTagOptionWithResource.documentation: Associate the specified TagOption with the specified portfolio or product.

CopyProduct.name: CopyProduct
CopyProduct.documentation:
Copies the specified source product to the specified target product or a new product.

You can copy a product to the same account or another account. You can copy a product to the same region or another region.

This operation is performed asynchronously. To track the progress of the operation, use DescribeCopyProductStatus.

CreatePortfolioShare.name: CreatePortfolioShare
CreatePortfolioShare.documentation: Shares the specified portfolio with the specified account.

CreateProvisionedProductPlan.name: CreateProvisionedProductPlan
CreateProvisionedProductPlan.documentation:
Creates a plan. A plan includes the list of resources to be created (when provisioning a new product) or modified (when updating a provisioned product) when the plan is executed.

You can create one plan per provisioned product. To create a plan for an existing provisioned product, the product status must be AVAILBLE or TAINTED.

To view the resource changes in the change set, use DescribeProvisionedProductPlan. To create or modify the provisioned product, use ExecuteProvisionedProductPlan.

CreateProvisioningArtifact.name: CreateProvisioningArtifact
CreateProvisioningArtifact.documentation:
Creates a provisioning artifact (also known as a version) for the specified product.

You cannot create a provisioning artifact for a product that was shared with you.

DeletePortfolio.name: DeletePortfolio
DeletePortfolio.documentation:
Deletes the specified portfolio.

You cannot delete a portfolio if it was shared with you or if it has associated products, users, constraints, or shared accounts.

DeletePortfolioShare.name: DeletePortfolioShare
DeletePortfolioShare.documentation: Stops sharing the specified portfolio with the specified account.

DeleteProduct.name: DeleteProduct
DeleteProduct.documentation:
Deletes the specified product.

You cannot delete a product if it was shared with you or is associated with a portfolio.

DeleteProvisioningArtifact.name: DeleteProvisioningArtifact
DeleteProvisioningArtifact.documentation:
Deletes the specified provisioning artifact (also known as a version) for the specified product.

You cannot delete a provisioning artifact associated with a product that was shared with you. You cannot delete the last provisioning artifact for a product, because a product must have at least one provisioning artifact.

DeleteTagOption.name: DeleteTagOption
DeleteTagOption.documentation:
Deletes the specified TagOption.

You cannot delete a TagOption if it is associated with a product or portfolio.

DescribeCopyProductStatus.name: DescribeCopyProductStatus
DescribeCopyProductStatus.documentation: Gets the status of the specified copy product operation.

DescribeProductAsAdmin.name: DescribeProductAsAdmin
DescribeProductAsAdmin.documentation: Gets information about the specified product. This operation is run with administrator access.

DescribeProvisionedProduct.name: DescribeProvisionedProduct
DescribeProvisionedProduct.documentation: Gets information about the specified provisioned product.

DescribeProvisionedProductPlan.name: DescribeProvisionedProductPlan
DescribeProvisionedProductPlan.documentation: Gets information about the resource changes for the specified plan.

DescribeProvisioningArtifact.name: DescribeProvisioningArtifact
DescribeProvisioningArtifact.documentation: Gets information about the specified provisioning artifact (also known as a version) for the specified product.

DescribeProvisioningParameters.name: DescribeProvisioningParameters
DescribeProvisioningParameters.documentation:
Gets information about the configuration required to provision the specified product using the specified provisioning artifact.

If the output contains a TagOption key with an empty list of values, there is a TagOption conflict for that key. The end user cannot take action to fix the conflict, and launch is not blocked. In subsequent calls to ProvisionProduct, do not include conflicted TagOption keys as tags, or this causes the error "Parameter validation failed: Missing required parameter in Tags[N]:Value". Tag the provisioned product with the value sc-tagoption-conflict-portfolioId-productId.

DescribeRecord.name: DescribeRecord
DescribeRecord.documentation:
Gets information about the specified request operation.

Use this operation after calling a request operation (for example, ProvisionProduct, TerminateProvisionedProduct, or UpdateProvisionedProduct).

DisassociatePrincipalFromPortfolio.name: DisassociatePrincipalFromPortfolio
DisassociatePrincipalFromPortfolio.documentation: Disassociates a previously associated principal ARN from a specified portfolio.

DisassociateProductFromPortfolio.name: DisassociateProductFromPortfolio
DisassociateProductFromPortfolio.documentation: Disassociates the specified product from the specified portfolio.

DisassociateTagOptionFromResource.name: DisassociateTagOptionFromResource
DisassociateTagOptionFromResource.documentation: Disassociates the specified TagOption from the specified resource.

ExecuteProvisionedProductPlan.name: ExecuteProvisionedProductPlan
ExecuteProvisionedProductPlan.documentation: Provisions or modifies a product based on the resource changes for the specified plan.

ListAcceptedPortfolioShares.name: ListAcceptedPortfolioShares
ListAcceptedPortfolioShares.documentation: Lists all portfolios for which sharing was accepted by this account.

ListConstraintsForPortfolio.name: ListConstraintsForPortfolio
ListConstraintsForPortfolio.documentation: Lists the constraints for the specified portfolio and product.

ListLaunchPaths.name: ListLaunchPaths
ListLaunchPaths.documentation: Lists the paths to the specified product. A path is how the user has access to a specified product, and is necessary when provisioning a product. A path also determines the constraints put on the product.

ListPortfolioAccess.name: ListPortfolioAccess
ListPortfolioAccess.documentation: Lists the account IDs that have access to the specified portfolio.

ListPortfoliosForProduct.name: ListPortfoliosForProduct
ListPortfoliosForProduct.documentation: Lists all portfolios that the specified product is associated with.

ListPrincipalsForPortfolio.name: ListPrincipalsForPortfolio
ListPrincipalsForPortfolio.documentation: Lists all principal ARNs associated with the specified portfolio.

ListProvisionedProductPlans.name: ListProvisionedProductPlans
ListProvisionedProductPlans.documentation: Lists the plans for the specified provisioned product or all plans to which the user has access.

ListProvisioningArtifacts.name: ListProvisioningArtifacts
ListProvisioningArtifacts.documentation: Lists all provisioning artifacts (also known as versions) for the specified product.

ListRecordHistory.name: ListRecordHistory
ListRecordHistory.documentation: Lists the specified requests or all performed requests.

ListResourcesForTagOption.name: ListResourcesForTagOption
ListResourcesForTagOption.documentation: Lists the resources associated with the specified TagOption.

ListTagOptions.name: ListTagOptions
ListTagOptions.documentation: Lists the specified TagOptions or all TagOptions.

ProvisionProduct.name: ProvisionProduct
ProvisionProduct.documentation:
Provisions the specified product.

A provisioned product is a resourced instance of a product. For example, provisioning a product based on a CloudFormation template launches a CloudFormation stack and its underlying resources. You can check the status of this request using DescribeRecord.

If the request contains a tag key with an empty list of values, there is a tag conflict for that key. Do not include conflicted keys as tags, or this causes the error "Parameter validation failed: Missing required parameter in Tags[N]:Value".

RejectPortfolioShare.name: RejectPortfolioShare
RejectPortfolioShare.documentation: Rejects an offer to share the specified portfolio.

ScanProvisionedProducts.name: ScanProvisionedProducts
ScanProvisionedProducts.documentation:
Lists the provisioned products that are available (not terminated).

To use additional filtering, see SearchProvisionedProducts.

SearchProducts.name: SearchProducts
SearchProducts.documentation: Gets information about the products to which the caller has access.

SearchProductsAsAdmin.name: SearchProductsAsAdmin
SearchProductsAsAdmin.documentation: Gets information about the products for the specified portfolio or all products.

SearchProvisionedProducts.name: SearchProvisionedProducts
SearchProvisionedProducts.documentation: Gets information about the provisioned products that meet the specified criteria.

TerminateProvisionedProduct.name: TerminateProvisionedProduct
TerminateProvisionedProduct.documentation:
Terminates the specified provisioned product.

This operation does not delete any records associated with the provisioned product.

You can check the status of this request using DescribeRecord.

UpdatePortfolio.name: UpdatePortfolio
UpdatePortfolio.documentation:
Updates the specified portfolio.

You cannot update a product that was shared with you.

UpdateProvisionedProduct.name: UpdateProvisionedProduct
UpdateProvisionedProduct.documentation:
Requests updates to the configuration of the specified provisioned product.

If there are tags associated with the object, they cannot be updated or added. Depending on the specific updates requested, this operation can update with no interruption, with some interruption, or replace the provisioned product entirely.

You can check the status of this request using DescribeRecord.

UpdateProvisioningArtifact.name: UpdateProvisioningArtifact
UpdateProvisioningArtifact.documentation:
Updates the specified provisioning artifact (also known as a version) for the specified product.

You cannot update a provisioning artifact for a product that was shared with you.

Key.documentation:
The access level.

  • Account - Filter results based on the account.

  • Role - Filter results based on the federated role of the specified user.

  • User - Filter results based on the specified user.

Value.documentation: The user to which the access level applies. The only supported value is Self.

AccessLevelFilter.documentation: The access level to use to filter results.

PrincipalARN.documentation: The ARN of the principal (IAM user, role, or group).

PrincipalType.documentation: The principal type. The supported value is IAM.

SourceProductArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source product.

TargetProductId.documentation: The identifier of the target product. By default, a new product is created.

TargetProductName.documentation: A name for the target product. The default is the name of the source product.

SourceProvisioningArtifactIdentifiers.documentation: The identifiers of the provisioning artifacts (also known as versions) of the product to copy. By default, all provisioning artifacts are copied.

CopyOptions.documentation: The copy options. If the value is CopyTags, the tags from the source product are copied to the target product.

IdempotencyToken.documentation: A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same response is returned for each repeated request.

CopyProductToken.documentation: The token to use to track the progress of the operation.

Parameters.documentation:
The constraint parameters, in JSON format. The syntax depends on the constraint type as follows:

LAUNCH

Specify the RoleArn property as follows:

\"RoleArn\" : \"arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/LaunchRole\"

NOTIFICATION

Specify the NotificationArns property as follows:

\"NotificationArns\" : [\"arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:123456789012:Topic\"]

TEMPLATE

Specify the Rules property. For more information, see Template Constraint Rules.

IdempotencyToken.documentation: A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same response is returned for each repeated request.

DisplayName.documentation: The name to use for display purposes.

IdempotencyToken.documentation: A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same response is returned for each repeated request.

Tags.documentation: Information about the tags associated with the portfolio.

IdempotencyToken.documentation: A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same response is returned for each repeated request.

Tags.documentation: Information about the tags associated with the product.

NotificationArns.documentation: Passed to CloudFormation. The SNS topic ARNs to which to publish stack-related events.

PathId.documentation: The path identifier of the product. This value is optional if the product has a default path, and required if the product has more than one path. To list the paths for a product, use ListLaunchPaths.

ProvisionedProductName.documentation: A user-friendly name for the provisioned product. This value must be unique for the AWS account and cannot be updated after the product is provisioned.

ProvisioningParameters.documentation: Parameters specified by the administrator that are required for provisioning the product.

IdempotencyToken.documentation: A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same response is returned for each repeated request.

ProvisionedProductName.documentation: The user-friendly name of the provisioned product.

IdempotencyToken.documentation: A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same response is returned for each repeated request.

Info.documentation: The URL of the CloudFormation template in Amazon S3, in JSON format.

IgnoreErrors.documentation: If set to true, AWS Service Catalog stops managing the specified provisioned product even if it cannot delete the underlying resources.

CopyProductToken.documentation: The token for the copy product operation. This token is returned by CopyProduct.

CopyProductStatus.documentation: The status of the copy product operation.

Tags.documentation: Information about the tags associated with the portfolio.

TagOptions.documentation: Information about the TagOptions associated with the portfolio.

ProvisioningArtifactSummaries.documentation: Information about the provisioning artifacts (also known as versions) for the specified product.

Tags.documentation: Information about the tags associated with the product.

TagOptions.documentation: Information about the TagOptions associated with the product.

ProvisioningArtifacts.documentation: Information about the provisioning artifacts for the specified product.
Information about the provisioning artifacts for the product.

CloudWatchDashboards.documentation: Any CloudWatch dashboards that were created when provisioning the product.

PageSize.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

PageToken.documentation: The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.

ResourceChanges.documentation: Information about the resource changes that will occur when the plan is executed.

NextPageToken.documentation: The page token to use to retrieve the next set of results. If there are no additional results, this value is null.

Verbose.documentation: Indicates whether a verbose level of detail is enabled.

Info.documentation: The URL of the CloudFormation template in Amazon S3.

PathId.documentation: The path identifier of the product. This value is optional if the product has a default path, and required if the product has more than one path. To list the paths for a product, use ListLaunchPaths.

ProvisioningArtifactParameters.documentation: Information about the parameters used to provision the product.

ConstraintSummaries.documentation: Information about the constraints used to provision the product.

UsageInstructions.documentation: Any additional metadata specifically related to the provisioning of the product. For example, see the Version field of the CloudFormation template.

TagOptions.documentation: Information about the TagOptions associated with the resource.

Id.documentation: The record identifier of the provisioned product. This identifier is returned by the request operation.

PageToken.documentation: The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.

PageSize.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

RecordOutputs.documentation: Information about the product created as the result of a request. For example, the output for a CloudFormation-backed product that creates an S3 bucket would include the S3 bucket URL.

NextPageToken.documentation: The page token to use to retrieve the next set of results. If there are no additional results, this value is null.

PrincipalARN.documentation: The ARN of the principal (IAM user, role, or group).

IdempotencyToken.documentation: A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same response is returned for each repeated request.

RecordDetail.documentation: Information about the result of provisioning the product.

InvalidParametersException.documentation: One or more parameters provided to the operation are not valid.

InvalidStateException.documentation: An attempt was made to modify a resource that is in a state that is not valid. Check your resources to ensure that they are in valid states before retrying the operation.

Tags.documentation: The tags associated with this product path.

Name.documentation: The name of the portfolio to which the user was assigned.

LaunchPathSummary.documentation: Summary information about a product path for a user.

LimitExceededException.documentation: The current limits of the service would have been exceeded by this operation. Decrease your resource use or increase your service limits and retry the operation.

PageToken.documentation: The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.

PageSize.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

NextPageToken.documentation: The page token to use to retrieve the next set of results. If there are no additional results, this value is null.

AccountIds.documentation: Information about the AWS accounts with access to the portfolio.

NextPageToken.documentation: The page token to use to retrieve the next set of results. If there are no additional results, this value is null.

NextPageToken.documentation: The page token to use to retrieve the next set of results. If there are no additional results, this value is null.

NextPageToken.documentation: The page token to use to retrieve the next set of results. If there are no additional results, this value is null.

PageSize.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

PageToken.documentation: The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.

Principals.documentation: The IAM principals (users or roles) associated with the portfolio.

NextPageToken.documentation: The page token to use to retrieve the next set of results. If there are no additional results, this value is null.

PageSize.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

PageToken.documentation: The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.

AccessLevelFilter.documentation: The access level to use to obtain results. The default is User.

NextPageToken.documentation: The page token to use to retrieve the next set of results. If there are no additional results, this value is null.
The page token to use to retrieve the next set of results. If there are no additional results, this value is null.

AccessLevelFilter.documentation: The access level to use to obtain results. The default is User.

SearchFilter.documentation: The search filter to scope the results.

PageSize.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

PageToken.documentation: The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.

NextPageToken.documentation: The page token to use to retrieve the next set of results. If there are no additional results, this value is null.

Key.documentation:
The filter key.

  • product - Filter results based on the specified product identifier.

  • provisionedproduct - Filter results based on the provisioned product identifier.

ListRecordHistorySearchFilter.documentation: The search filter to use when listing history records.

PageSize.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

PageToken.documentation: The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.
The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.

Filters.documentation: The search filters. If no search filters are specified, the output includes all TagOptions.

PageSize.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

PageToken.documentation: The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.
The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.

AllowedValues.documentation: The values that the administrator has allowed for the parameter.

ParameterConstraints.documentation: The constraints that the administrator has put on the parameter.

DisplayName.documentation: The name to use for display purposes.

CreatedTime.documentation: The UTC time stamp of the creation time.

PrincipalARN.documentation: The ARN of the principal (IAM user, role, or group).

PrincipalType.documentation: The principal type. The supported value is IAM.

Value.documentation: The value of the product view aggregation.

ApproximateCount.documentation: An approximate count of the products that match the value.

ProductViewAggregationValue.documentation: A single product view aggregation value/count pair, containing metadata about each product to which the calling user has access.

Status.documentation:
The status of the product.

  • AVAILABLE - The product is ready for use.

  • CREATING - Product creation has started; the product is not ready for use.

  • FAILED - An action failed.

CreatedTime.documentation: The UTC time stamp of the creation time.

Owner.documentation: The owner of the product. Contact the product administrator for the significance of this value.

Type.documentation: The product type. Contact the product administrator for the significance of this value. If this value is MARKETPLACE, the product was created by AWS Marketplace.

Distributor.documentation: The distributor of the product. Contact the product administrator for the significance of this value.

HasDefaultPath.documentation: Indicates whether the product has a default path. If the product does not have a default path, call ListLaunchPaths to disambiguate between paths. Otherwise, ListLaunchPaths is not required, and the output of ProductViewSummary can be used directly with DescribeProvisioningParameters.

SupportEmail.documentation: The email contact information to obtain support for this Product.

SupportDescription.documentation: The description of the support for this Product.

SupportUrl.documentation: The URL information to obtain support for this Product.

PathId.documentation: The path identifier of the product. This value is optional if the product has a default path, and required if the product has more than one path. To list the paths for a product, use ListLaunchPaths.

ProvisionedProductName.documentation: A user-friendly name for the provisioned product. This value must be unique for the AWS account and cannot be updated after the product is provisioned.

ProvisioningParameters.documentation: Parameters specified by the administrator that are required for provisioning the product.

NotificationArns.documentation: Passed to CloudFormation. The SNS topic ARNs to which to publish stack-related events.

ProvisionToken.documentation: An idempotency token that uniquely identifies the provisioning request.

RecordDetail.documentation: Information about the result of provisioning the product.

Name.documentation: The user-friendly name of the provisioned product.

Type.documentation: The type of provisioned product. The supported value is CFN_STACK.

Status.documentation:
The current status of the provisioned product.

  • AVAILABLE - Stable state, ready to perform any operation. The most recent operation succeeded and completed.

  • UNDER_CHANGE - Transitive state, operations performed might not have valid results. Wait for an AVAILABLE status before performing operations.

  • TAINTED - Stable state, ready to perform any operation. The stack has completed the requested operation but is not exactly what was requested. For example, a request to update to a new version failed and the stack rolled back to the current version.

  • ERROR - An unexpected error occurred, the provisioned product exists but the stack is not running. For example, CloudFormation received a parameter value that was not valid and could not launch the stack.

StatusMessage.documentation: The current status message of the provisioned product.

CreatedTime.documentation: The UTC time stamp of the creation time.

IdempotencyToken.documentation: A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same response is returned for each repeated request.

LastRecordId.documentation: The record identifier of the last request performed on this provisioned product.

PhysicalId.documentation: The assigned identifier for the resource, such as an EC2 instance ID or an S3 bucket name.

UserArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM user.

UserArnSession.documentation: The ARN of the IAM user in the session. This ARN might contain a session ID.

Name.documentation: The user-friendly name of the provisioned product.

Type.documentation: The type of provisioned product. The supported value is CFN_STACK.

Status.documentation:
The current status of the provisioned product.

  • AVAILABLE - Stable state, ready to perform any operation. The most recent operation succeeded and completed.

  • UNDER_CHANGE - Transitive state, operations performed might not have valid results. Wait for an AVAILABLE status before performing operations.

  • TAINTED - Stable state, ready to perform any operation. The stack has completed the requested operation but is not exactly what was requested. For example, a request to update to a new version failed and the stack rolled back to the current version.

  • ERROR - An unexpected error occurred, the provisioned product exists but the stack is not running. For example, CloudFormation received a parameter value that was not valid and could not launch the stack.

StatusMessage.documentation: The current status message of the provisioned product.

CreatedTime.documentation: The UTC time stamp of the creation time.

IdempotencyToken.documentation: A unique identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency. If multiple requests differ only by the idempotency token, the same response is returned for each repeated request.

LastRecordId.documentation: The record identifier of the last request performed on this provisioned product.

CreatedTime.documentation: The UTC time stamp of the creation time.

PathId.documentation: The path identifier of the product. This value is optional if the product has a default path, and required if the product has more than one path. To list the paths for a product, use ListLaunchPaths.

ProvisionProductName.documentation: The user-friendly name of the provisioned product.

UpdatedTime.documentation: The time when the plan was last updated.

NotificationArns.documentation: Passed to CloudFormation. The SNS topic ARNs to which to publish stack-related events.

ProvisioningParameters.documentation: Parameters specified by the administrator that are required for provisioning the product.

ProvisionProductName.documentation: The user-friendly name of the provisioned product.

CreatedTime.documentation: The UTC time stamp of the creation time.

ProvisioningArtifact.documentation: Information about a provisioning artifact. A provisioning artifact is also known as a product version.

Type.documentation:
The type of provisioning artifact.

  • CLOUD_FORMATION_TEMPLATE - AWS CloudFormation template

  • MARKETPLACE_AMI - AWS Marketplace AMI

  • MARKETPLACE_CAR - AWS Marketplace Clusters and AWS Resources

CreatedTime.documentation: The UTC time stamp of the creation time.

Active.documentation: Indicates whether the product version is active.

ProvisioningArtifactDetail.documentation: Information about a provisioning artifact (also known as a version) for a product.

IsNoEcho.documentation: If this value is true, the value for this parameter is obfuscated from view when the parameter is retrieved. This parameter is used to hide sensitive information.

ParameterConstraints.documentation: Constraints that the administrator has put on a parameter.

ProvisioningArtifactParameter.documentation: Information about a parameter used to provision a product.

Name.documentation: The name of the provisioning artifact (for example, v1 v2beta). No spaces are allowed.

Description.documentation: The description of the provisioning artifact, including how it differs from the previous provisioning artifact.

Info.documentation:
The URL of the CloudFormation template in Amazon S3. Specify the URL in JSON format as follows:

"LoadTemplateFromURL": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/cf-templates-ozkq9d3hgiq2-us-east-1/..."

Type.documentation:
The type of provisioning artifact.

  • CLOUD_FORMATION_TEMPLATE - AWS CloudFormation template

  • MARKETPLACE_AMI - AWS Marketplace AMI

  • MARKETPLACE_CAR - AWS Marketplace Clusters and AWS Resources

ProvisioningArtifactProperties.documentation: Information about a provisioning artifact (also known as a version) for a product.

CreatedTime.documentation: The UTC time stamp of the creation time.

ProvisioningArtifactMetadata.documentation: The metadata for the provisioning artifact. This is used with AWS Marketplace products.

ProvisioningArtifactSummary.documentation: Summary information about a provisioning artifact (also known as a version) for a product.

ProvisioningParameter.documentation: Information about a parameter used to provision a product.

ProvisionedProductName.documentation: The user-friendly name of the provisioned product.

Status.documentation:
The status of the provisioned product.

  • CREATED - The request was created but the operation has not started.

  • IN_PROGRESS - The requested operation is in progress.

  • IN_PROGRESS_IN_ERROR - The provisioned product is under change but the requested operation failed and some remediation is occurring. For example, a rollback.

  • SUCCEEDED - The requested operation has successfully completed.

  • FAILED - The requested operation has unsuccessfully completed. Investigate using the error messages returned.

CreatedTime.documentation: The UTC time stamp of the creation time.

UpdatedTime.documentation: The time when the record was last updated.

ProvisionedProductType.documentation: The type of provisioned product. The supported value is CFN_STACK.

RecordError.documentation: The error code and description resulting from an operation.

RecordOutput.documentation: The output for the product created as the result of a request. For example, the output for a CloudFormation-backed product that creates an S3 bucket would include the S3 bucket URL.

RecordTag.documentation: Information about a tag, which is a key-value pair.

LogicalResourceId.documentation: The ID of the resource, as defined in the CloudFormation template.

PhysicalResourceId.documentation: The ID of the resource, if it was already created.

Replacement.documentation: If the change type is Modify, indicates whether the existing resource is deleted and replaced with a new one.

ResourceChange.documentation: Information about a resource change that will occur when a plan is executed.

Target.documentation: Information about the resource attribute to be modified.

Evaluation.documentation: For static evaluations, the value of the resource attribute will change and the new value is known. For dynamic evaluations, the value might change, and any new value will be determined when the plan is updated.

CausingEntity.documentation: The ID of the entity that caused the change.

ResourceChangeDetail.documentation: Information about a change to a resource attribute.

ResourceInUseException.documentation: A resource that is currently in use. Ensure that the resource is not in use and retry the operation.

Name.documentation: If the attribute is Properties, the value is the name of the property. Otherwise, the value is null.

RequiresRecreation.documentation: If the attribute is Properties, indicates whether a change to this property causes the resource to be re-created.

ResourceTargetDefinition.documentation: Information about a change to a resource attribute.

AccessLevelFilter.documentation: The access level to use to obtain results. The default is User.

PageSize.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

PageToken.documentation: The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.

NextPageToken.documentation: The page token to use to retrieve the next set of results. If there are no additional results, this value is null.

Filters.documentation: The search filters. If no search filters are specified, the output includes all products to which the administrator has access.

SortBy.documentation: The sort field. If no value is specified, the results are not sorted.

SortOrder.documentation: The sort order. If no value is specified, the results are not sorted.

PageToken.documentation: The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.

PageSize.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

ProductSource.documentation: Access level of the source of the product.

NextPageToken.documentation: The page token to use to retrieve the next set of results. If there are no additional results, this value is null.

Filters.documentation: The search filters. If no search filters are specified, the output includes all products to which the caller has access.

PageSize.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

SortBy.documentation: The sort field. If no value is specified, the results are not sorted.

SortOrder.documentation: The sort order. If no value is specified, the results are not sorted.

PageToken.documentation: The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.

NextPageToken.documentation: The page token to use to retrieve the next set of results. If there are no additional results, this value is null.

AccessLevelFilter.documentation: The access level to use to obtain results. The default is User.

Filters.documentation:
The search filters.

When the key is SearchQuery, the searchable fields are arn, createdTime, id, lastRecordId, idempotencyToken, name, physicalId, productId, provisioningArtifact, type, status, tags, userArn, and userArnSession.

Example: "SearchQuery":["status:AVAILABLE"]

SortBy.documentation: The sort field. If no value is specified, the results are not sorted. The valid values are arn, id, name, and lastRecordId.

SortOrder.documentation: The sort order. If no value is specified, the results are not sorted.

PageSize.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

PageToken.documentation: The page token for the next set of results. To retrieve the first set of results, use null.

NextPageToken.documentation: The page token to use to retrieve the next set of results. If there are no additional results, this value is null.

Tag.documentation: Information about a tag. A tag is a key-value pair. Tags are propagated to the resources created when provisioning a product.

TagOptionNotMigratedException.documentation: An operation requiring TagOptions failed because the TagOptions migration process has not been performed for this account. Please use the AWS console to perform the migration process before retrying the operation.

ProvisionedProductName.documentation: The name of the provisioned product. You cannot specify both ProvisionedProductName and ProvisionedProductId.

ProvisionedProductId.documentation: The identifier of the provisioned product. You cannot specify both ProvisionedProductName and ProvisionedProductId.

TerminateToken.documentation: An idempotency token that uniquely identifies the termination request. This token is only valid during the termination process. After the provisioned product is terminated, subsequent requests to terminate the same provisioned product always return ResourceNotFound.

IgnoreErrors.documentation: If set to true, AWS Service Catalog stops managing the specified provisioned product even if it cannot delete the underlying resources.

RecordDetail.documentation: Information about the result of this request.

DisplayName.documentation: The name to use for display purposes.

ProviderName.documentation: The updated name of the portfolio provider.

Tags.documentation: Information about the tags associated with the portfolio.

SupportDescription.documentation: The updated support description for the product.

SupportEmail.documentation: The updated support email for the product.

SupportUrl.documentation: The updated support URL for the product.

AddTags.documentation: The tags to add to the product.

RemoveTags.documentation: The tags to remove from the product.

Tags.documentation: Information about the tags associated with the product.

ProvisionedProductName.documentation: The updated name of the provisioned product. You cannot specify both ProvisionedProductName and ProvisionedProductId.

ProvisionedProductId.documentation: The identifier of the provisioned product. You cannot specify both ProvisionedProductName and ProvisionedProductId.

PathId.documentation: The new path identifier. This value is optional if the product has a default path, and required if the product has more than one path.

UpdateToken.documentation: The idempotency token that uniquely identifies the provisioning update request.

RecordDetail.documentation: Information about the result of the request.

Name.documentation: The updated name of the provisioning artifact.

Description.documentation: The updated description of the provisioning artifact.

Active.documentation: Indicates whether the product version is active.

Info.documentation: The URL of the CloudFormation template in Amazon S3.

UsePreviousValue.documentation: If set to true, Value is ignored and the previous parameter value is kept.

UpdateProvisioningParameter.documentation: The parameter key-value pair used to update a provisioned product.

Type.documentation: The usage instruction type for the value.

Value.documentation: The usage instruction value for this type.

documentation:
AWS Service Catalog

AWS Service Catalog enables organizations to create and manage catalogs of IT services that are approved for use on AWS. To get the most out of this documentation, you should be familiar with the terminology discussed in AWS Service Catalog Concepts.
